name: Te Ara Whakapuawai - Numeracy
Te Ara Whakapuawai - Reading
Te Ara Whakapuawai - Writing
Te Ara Whakapuawai - Total Communication
Te Ara Whakapuawai - Te Ao Maori
Number & Algebra 2-3 - Early Level 1
Number & Algebra 4 - At Level 1
Number & Algebra - Actively participate
Number & Algebra - Consolidate
Number & Algebra Early 5 - Early Level 2
Number & Algebra - Engage
Number & Algebra - Experience
Number & Algebra - Respond
Num/N EL.10. Recognise numicon numbers on a number line
Num/N EL.11. The student will tell which is first, second, third of objects in a line.
Num/N EL.12. The student will say which group has more or less within the range of 1-10.
Num/N EL.13. The student will say which group has more or less using numicon within the range of 1-10.
Num/N EL.14. The student will begin to recognise numbers from 1-10 and relate them to sets of objects.
Num/N EL.15. The student will begin to recognise numbers from 1-10 and relate them to numicon.
Num/N L4.10. The student will order numbers in the range 1-100.
Num/N L4.11. The student will add to objects in practical situations.
Num/N L4.12. The student will take away objects in practical situations.
Num/N L4.13. The student will take away or ad to objects in practical situations using numicon.
Num/N L4.14. The student will tell which is first, second, third of objects in a line.
Num/N L4.15. The student will say the number aftera given number in the range 1-50.
NumN/AP 1A. Recognise that a choice has to be made when selecting materials and equipment for a simple activity.
NumN/AP 2A. Participate in mathematical activities, participate in daily routines. Follow a sequence of actions.
NumN/AP 2B. Participate in mathematical activities, participate in daily routines. Indicate 1 or 2.
NumN/AP 2C. Participate in mathematical activities, participate in daily routines. Assign a number name to a number.
NumN/AP 2D. Participate in mathematical activities, participate in daily routines. Make marks that represent a number.
NumN/AP 2E. Participate in mathematical activities, participate in daily routines. Touch count up to 10.
NumN/AP 2F. Participate in mathematical activities rote count to 10.
NumN/C 1A. Make choices in selecting materials and equipment for a simple activity.
NumN/C 2A. Show some understanding of mathematial notations, such as numerals, words, sets - Anicipate and follow daily routines.
NumN/C 2B. Show some understanding of mathematial notations, such as numerals, words - Posiion numbers on a line.
NumN/C 2C. Show some understanding of mathematial notations, such as numerals, words - Student will count at least five objects.
NumN/C 2D. Show some understanding of mathematial notations, such as numerals, words - Students will recognise numbers up to 5 and understand that each represents a constant amount.
NumN/C 2E. Show some understanding of mathematial notations, such as numerals, words - Students willrecognise quantity such as more/les, bigger/smaller.
NumN/C 2F. Show some understanding of mathematial notations, such as numerals, words - Match and demostrate an understanding of 1:1correspondance and terms more or less, not enough and the same.
NumN E5 10. The student will skip count in 2's to 100, forwards and backwards.
NumN E5 11. The student will skip count in 3's to 100, forwards and backwards.
NumN E5 12. The student will skip count in 5's to 100, forwards and backwards.
NumN E5 13. The student will skip count in 10's to 100, forwards and backwards.
NumN E5 14. The student will skip count in 2's, 3's, 5's, and 10's to 100, forwards and backwards.
NumN E5 15. The student orders numbers in the range of 0-500.
NumN E5 16. The student orders numbers in the range of 0-1000.
NumN E5 17. The student orders fractions with like denominators e.g., 1/4, 2/4, 3/4.
NumN/Eng 1A. Engage with mathematical materials in response to teacher guidance/modelling. Interact with a range of materials with support match two unequal and two equal sets.
NumN/Eng 2A. Recognise mathematical activities in response to cues and prompts; engage with daily routines in response to teacher moddelling; imitate touch counting to 10.
NumN/Eng 2B. Recognise mathematical activities in response to cues and prompts; engage with daily routines in response to teacher moddelling; join in rote counting.
NumN/Eng 2C. Recognise mathematical activities in response to cues and prompts; engage with daily routines in response to teacher moddelling; show 1-2 fingers.

NumN/Eng 2D. Recognise mathematical activities in response to cues and prompts; engage with daily routines in response to teacher moddelling; begin to show consistent response to objects and counting activities.
NumN/Eng 2E. Recognise mathematical activities in response to cues and prompts; engage with daily routines in response to teacher moddelling; trach items that are being counted.
NumN/E 1A. Encounter a variety of mathematical materials and equipment; experience a range of materials.
NumN/E 1B. Encounter a variety of mathematical materials and equipment; students may show a reflex response.

NumN/E 1C. Encounter a variety of mathematical materials and equipment; students may show simple reflex responses when encountering patterns of sound,light, or objects e.g. light sequenceplayed ontobody or hand wih a torch.
NumN/E 1D. Encounter a variety of mathematical materials and equipment; E.g numicon shapes.
NumN/E 1E. Encounter a variety of mathematical materials and equipment; encounter through senses objects being built and knocked down.
NumN/R 1A. Interact with materials and equipment; respond with some interest to a range of materials lego, blocks, numicon, sensory play.
NumN/R 1B. Interact with materials and equipment; The students will cooperate with shared exploration and participation with support.
NumN/R 2A. Respond to mathematical activities and become aware of daily routines. Students will perform actions, often b trial and improvments and remember learned responses over a period of time.

NumN/R 2B. Respond to mathematical activities and become aware of daily routines. Respond intermittently to activities that include real/pretend coins and real/pretend shopping situations which involve giving and recieving. Numicon matching puzzles.
NumN/R 3A. Become aware of the existanceof a problem, respond and interact with simple logical strategies. Students will demonstrate understanding of the concept 'all gone'.
Reading - Actively Participate
Reading - Consolidate
Reading - Early Level 1
Reading - Engage
Reading - Experience
Reading - Level 1
Reading - Level 2
Reading - Respond
READ/AP 1A: Actively participate in an activity with a range of texts/images for information, ideas and enjoyment; Choose a book

READ/AP 1B: Actively participate in an activity with a range of texts/images for information, ideas and enjoyment; Hold a book the right way up and turn the pages sequentially, looking at the pictures to make sense of the story or information.

READ/AP 1C: Actively participate in an activity with a range of texts/images for information, ideas and enjoyment; Show understanding of a story or information read to them, such as sequencing pictures,answering questions.
READ/AP 1D: Actively participate in an activity with a range of texts/images for information, ideas and enjoyment; Turn the pages of a book appropriately.
READ/CON 1A: Show understanding that meaning can be taken from pictures, images and texts; Pretend to read a book, he/she may point to pictures and texts.
READ/CON 1B: Show understanding that meaning can be taken from pictures, images and texts; Participate in reading behaviour such as read a story to an audience (toys or peers).
READ/CON 1C: Show understanding that meaning can be taken from pictures, images and texts; Participate in simple words matching activities.

READ/CON 1D: Show understanding that meaning can be taken from pictures, images and texts; Demonstrate an understanding that meaning can be taken from pictures, images and texts while navigating an online story.
READ/EL 1.10: Listen to and participate in reading of stories, rhymes and poems.
READ/EL 1.11: Handle books correctly.
READ/EL 1.12: Explore and develop recognition of capital letters and full stops.
READ/EL 1.13: Discriminate among picture, text, cover, letter, word, first, last, top, bottom, front, back, page, story.
READ/EL 1.14: Develop an awareness rhyme, rhythm and alliteration.
READ/Eng 1A: Purposefully engage for longer periods of time with a range of texts/images for information, ideas, and enjoyment; Enjoy hearing a familiar story.
READ/Eng 1B: Purposefully engage for longer periods of time with a range of texts/images for information, ideas, and enjoyment; Willingly engage with an adult/peer in sharing a book.
READ/E 1A: Experience a range of texts/images for information, ideas and enjoyment; Experience a CD story supported by the text.
READ/E 1B: Experience a range of texts/images for information, ideas and enjoyment; Experience a story shared through a picture on an interactive whiteboard (or current ICT display unit).
READ L1.10: Identify rhythm, alliteration and rhyming words in text (orally).
READ L1.11: Develop an understanding of question marks.
READ L2.10: Justify own options of texts.
READ L2.11: Discuss morals and values.
READ/R 1A: Respond intermittently to a range of texts/images for information, ideas and enjoyment; intermittently listen to a CD story supported by the text.

READ/R 1B: Respond intermittently to a range of texts/images for information, ideas and enjoyment; intermittently listen to a CD story through the medium of an interactive whiteboard (or current ICT display unit).
Actively Participate
Engage
Experience
Respond
Writing - consolidate
Writing Early Level 1
Writing - Level 1
Writing - Level 2
WRITE/AP 1A: Participate in modelled writing activities; Make decisions on what should be included in shared writing by answering/indicationg 'yes' or 'no'.
WRITE/AP 1B: Participate in modelled writing activities; Use computer programmes to participate in writing activites.
WRITE/ENG 1A: Engage in modelled writing activities; Watch an adult write.
WRITE/ENG 1B: Engage in modelled writing activities; Imitate the use of writing tools and surfaces.
WRITE/E 1A: Experience writing activities; Experience a range of multi-sensory stimuli, such as dough, soapy water, pasta.
WRITE/E 1B: Experience writing activities; Experience the teacher demonstrating writing or mark-making activites.
WRITE/R 1A: Respond intermittently to writing activites; Respond intermittently to a range of multi-sensory stimuli.
WRITE/R 1B: Respond intermittently to writing activites; Listen and look intermittently at an adult writing or making marks(using pictures/patterns/symbols and/or words).
WRITE/CON 1A: Begin to make contributions to shared writing activities; Make some suggestions on what to write or draw in shared writing using signing, eye pointing, pointing at pictures.
WRITE/CON 1B: Begin to make contributions to shared writing activities; Ask an adult to write words/draw pictures of personal interest (asking may be non-verbal).
WRITE/EL 1.10: Link sounds to letter symbols.
WRITE/EL 1.11: Use approximations according to the initial sound.
WRITE/L 1.10: Use the beginning and end sounds of words.
WRITE/L 1.11: Use some initial blends.
WRITE/L 2.10: Use phonetic knowledge.
WRITE/L 2.11: use adjectives when writing.
